metadata.synopsis: A singing stoker (Paul Robeson) finds work in a Welsh coal mine, where he is called upon to make a grave sacrifice when a pit disaster threatens his fellow miners.

reviews: The direc- tion of the quiet documentary scenes is good, but Mr. Pen Tennyson, who may have been handicapped by an undis- tinguished cast and a wobbly script, seems ill at ease with drama.
This moving and enthrallingly interesting story of courage, endurance and self-sacrifice is an outstanding achievement for all concerned.
